story.storybody:
On World Environment Day, Mahindra Electric has launched its second all electric car in the country, with the base price for the e-Verito starting at Rs 9.50 lakh (ex showroom, New Delhi). Mahindra is already selling the e2o electric hatchback in the country.

ALSO READ: Mahindra to launch e-Verito electric sedan on June 2

The Mahindra e-Verito electric sedan will be available in three trim levels- D2, D4 and D6 with the prices for D4 and D6 are Rs 9.75 lakh and Rs 10 lakh (all ex showroom, New Delhi) respectively.

The Mahindra Electric Verito sedan is powered by the latest electric drive train from Mahindra Reva, and is a 100 per cent zero emission, green vehicle.

ALSO READ: Mahindra launches TUV300 with mHAWK 100 engine; prices start at Rs 8.87 lakh

The upcoming Mahindra e-Verito will come with a 72V 3-phase AC induction motor producing maximum gross power of 41 hp @3500 rpm and maximum torque of 91 Nm @3000 rpm, mated to a automatic transmission.

The automatic transmission Mahindra e-Verito sedan can be charged at home and can also be quick charged in 2 hours through fast charging (top-end). It offers an exceptionally smooth and noiseless driving experience and comes with features like hill-hold and great stand-still pick-up.

ALSO READ: Mahindra XUV500 gets automatic transmission for W6 variant

In one charge, Mahindra e-Verito can travel for up to 100 kms based on vehicle loading and can achieve a top speed of 86 kmph. It also comes with ECO drive mode and remote diagnostics which includes real time and immediate assistance no matter where you are.

Mahindra will start selling the e-Verito in Delhi first, with plans to add Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Nagpur to the list soon.
